title: Module 4 Pt 1: Extension for Climate-Smart Agriculture

tasks.task: Understand the role and methodology of agricultural extension.
subtasks: Define agricultural extension as the application of new knowledge derived from applied research to agricultural practices through farmer engagement and education.
Explain that extension is a two-way communication process involving farmers, researchers, and extension professionals.
Discuss the necessity of strong relationships and cooperation among farmers, extension personnel, and researchers in effective extension services.
Highlight the potential of extension in addressing sustainability challenges such as climate change mitigation and adaptation in agriculture.

tasks.task: Describe the Cooperative Extension Service model in the United States.
subtasks: Explain the structure of the Cooperative Extension Service involving federal, state, and local governments, as well as land-grant universities.
Illustrate how the Cooperative Extension Service facilitates communication and collaboration between multiple stakeholders in agricultural research and extension.

tasks.task: Emphasize the importance of extension in advancing sustainable agricultural practices.
subtasks: Recognize extension as a critical fulcrum for sector advancement and change in addressing complex sustainability challenges.
Highlight the role of extension in facilitating cooperation and knowledge mobilization across various agricultural stakeholders.
